sub_title: Head of film at Filmhuis Den Haag
summary:
Filmhuis Den Haag
Curating and Connecting are two important vocal points of FHDH.
We curate a diverse portofolio of world cinema, with an emphasis on European cinema and a balanced and consistent programming of popular art house titles and more vulnerable films who need more attention in keeping them visible and therefore important.
Curatorship is also making choices in programs related to filmhistory: from the forgotten films of Valerio Zurlini to the social realist films of Ken Loach.

Connecting is what we do in collaborating with other cultural institutions in town and different communities
We Connect with the profile of The Hague as city of peace and justice and collaborate with human rights organisations, European commissions and embassies.
And different communities in The Hague can Connect with us like students, surfers, hip hoppers, immigrants, minority groups, expats, you name it. They all come with their own wishes and, in some cases, are very eager to provide us with guest programming. This way we try to host and celebrate the cultural diversity of the population of The Hague.
In 2015 FHDH received the Europa Cinemas Award for 'best programming'.
